conclusion: A uniform electric field is formed between two parallel metal plates A and B carrying opposite charges. An electron is injected into the electric field along the central line perpendicular to the direction of the electric field with an initial velocity v0 = 4 × 10^6 m/s from point O. When the electron exits the electric field at point C on the right edge, its velocity direction forms a 30° angle with the direction of v0. The charge of the electron is e = 1.6 × 10^-19 C, and the mass of the electron is m = 0.91 × 10^-30 kg.

premise: The electron's velocity at point C forms a 30° angle with the initial velocity v0.
conclusion: The horizontal component of the velocity at point C is vx = v0.

premise: The electron's velocity at point C forms a 30° angle with the initial velocity v0.
conclusion: The vertical component of the velocity at point C is vy = v0 tan(30°).

premise: The horizontal component of the velocity at point C is vx = v0 and the vertical component is vy ≈ 2.31 × 10^6 m/s.
conclusion: The magnitude of the velocity at point C is vC = √(vx^2 + vy^2).

premise: The magnitude of the velocity at point C is vC ≈ 4.62 × 10^6 m/s.
conclusion: The kinetic energy K at point C is given by K = 1/2 m vC^2.
